wikipedia_page.main: Wallis Hensman Clark (2 March 1882 – 14 February 1961) was an English stage and film actor.

link_mentions.page: List of actors who have appeared in multiple Best Picture Academy Award winners
response: * Most Appearances in Best Picture Nominees -  Actors who appeared in the most Best Picture nominees are: Bess Flowers (23 films - all uncredited), Ward Bond (13 films, 4 uncredited), Robert De Niro (11 films, 1 uncredited), Franklyn Farnum (11 films - all uncredited), Jack Nicholson (10 films), Leonardo DiCaprio (9 films), William Holden (9 films), Spencer Tracy (9 films), Elizabeth Taylor (9 films, 2 uncredited), Gary Cooper (9 films), Tom Hanks (9 films), Al Pacino (8 films), Lionel Barrymore (8 films), Olivia de Havilland (8 films), Daniel Day-Lewis (8 films), Robert Duvall (8 films, 1 uncredited), Henry Fonda (8 films), Harrison Ford (8 films), John Gielgud (8 films), Dustin Hoffman (8 films), Burt Lancaster (8 films), Reginald Owen (8 films), Gregory Peck (8 films), Claude Rains (8 films), Tom Wilkinson (8 films), Brad Pitt (8 films), Cate Blanchett (7 films), Beulah Bondi (7 films), Marlon Brando (7 films), John Carradine (7 films), Wallis Clark (7 films, 6 uncredited), Gladys Cooper (7 films), Finlay Currie (7 films), Katharine Hepburn (7 films), Harvey Keitel (7 films, 1 uncredited), Deborah Kerr (7 films), Elsa Lanchester (7 films), Fredric March (7 films), Laurence Olivier (7 films, 1 uncredited), James Stewart (7 films), Bette Davis (7 films), Meryl Streep (7 films), and Michael Stuhlbarg (7 films).
* Most Appearances in Best Picture Winners -  Actors who appeared in the most Best Picture winners are: Franklyn Farnum (7 films), Wallis Clark (5 films), and Bess Flowers (5 films).
* Most Consecutive Appearances -  Actors who appeared in three consecutive Best Picture winners are: Wallis Clark (1934 through 1936) and Harry Davenport (1937 through 1939).

link_mentions.page: The Last of Mrs. Cheyney (1937 film)

response: Joan prods her husband into taking an interest in his family business. To his surprise, he finds that he enjoys it. As the new Postmaster General (Wallis Clark) is a good friend of her father's, Joan invites him to dinner, hoping to land a government contract for John's company.
* Wallis Clark as Postmaster General Oliver Lane

link_mentions.page: They Just Had to Get Married

response: Star Reporter, John Randolph (Warren Hull), with his fiancée, Barbara Burnette, (Marsha Hunt), has faith in her father, D.A. William Burnette (Wallis Clark), and throws the full weight of his newspaper behind him, in hopes of tracking down his own father's killer.
*Wallis Clark as District Attorney William Burnette
* Wallis Clark as Henry W. Philpot
* Wallis Clark as District Attorney James A. Crowell
*Wallis Clark as City Treasurer R. R. McCall
*Wallis Clark as Mr. Bowen - Barbershop Customer (uncredited)
